intro: Bobartia longicyma subsp. magna, commonly known as the giant bobartia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its large, elongated leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in mountainous regions. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological features compared to other members of the Bobartia genus.
